Project Modules

This section provides auto-generated documentation for all modules within the Chimera Intel project’s core directory. The :members: option ensures that all functions, classes, and methods within each module are documented.

Core Intelligence & Analysis

class chimera_intel.core.correlation_engine.CorrelationEngine(plugin_manager: PluginManager, config: Dict[str, Any])[source]

Framework & Utility Modules

Module for high-level analysis, automation, and integration.

This module provides tools for data enrichment, threat modeling, behavioral analysis (UEBA), and workflow automation.

chimera_intel.core.automation.analyze_behavioral_logs(log_file: str) → UEBAResult[source]

Analyzes user activity logs to find statistical anomalies.

This function establishes a baseline of normal activity (login hours, source IPs) for each user from a log file and then flags events that deviate from this baseline. It expects a CSV log with at least the following headers: ‘timestamp’, ‘user’, ‘source_ip’.

Parameters:

log_file (str) – Path to the user activity log file in CSV format.

Returns:

A Pydantic model with a list of detected behavioral anomalies.

Return type:

UEBAResult

Configuration loader for the Chimera Intel application.

This module is responsible for loading all application configurations and secrets. It follows a priority system for loading secrets: 1. HashiCorp Vault (for production) 2. Environment variables (can be populated by a .env file for development)

It also centralizes the creation of the SQLAlchemy database URL.

chimera_intel.core.utils.save_or_print_results(data: Dict[str, Any], output_file: str | None) → None[source]

Handles the output of scan results.

This function saves the provided data to a JSON file if an output path is given. Otherwise, it prints the data to the console in a beautifully formatted and syntax-highlighted way using the rich library.

Parameters:

  • data (Dict[str, Any]) – The dictionary containing the scan results.

  • output_file (str | None) – The file path to save the JSON output. If None, prints to the console.
